peopleAlsoAsk.question: What do the numbers mean on butter churns?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Dazey Butter Churns Featured Different Styles They have a number one, two, three, four, six or eight written on the side. The numbers indicate the jar's quart size. Dazey's manufacturing plant was located in the north in St. Louis, Missouri. The Dazey plant began making jars in 1917.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Antique Dazey Butter Churns - Texas Vintage Shop Directory

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the oldest butter churn?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The oldest form of butter churn is the rocker churn. Made of goat skin bags, gourds, or even glass jars, these simple vessels have been used to agitate cream for thousands of years and were operated via shaking or rocking – hence the name.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Nineteenth Century Barrel Butter Churn - Rosenberg Library Museum

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you identify a dazey butter churn?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: There are several types of original Dazey churns. The types are identified by how factory markings are arranged, such as the Round Label-style shown in Fig. 1; the appearance of patent dates, such as the Patent Date-style in Fig. 4; or the shape of the tops or sides, such as Slope Shouldered and Bevel Edged.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: More Dazey Churns Reproduced - Real Or Repro

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How does an antique butter churn work?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: A plunger butter churn is the most historically outstanding type. It often consists of a wooden barrel and a stick that has a disc with holes attached to it. One had to pour milk or cream into the barrel and move the stick up and down inside it for a good 60-90 minutes in order to produce butter.
